description: The University of Southern California canceled its main stage graduation ceremony as the campus is roiled by Israel-Hamas war protests.
title: USC Cancels Main Commencement Ceremony Amid Israel-Hamas War Protests

description: Popping your zits can cause a host of problems, from scarring to infection. Here's what dermatologists say to do instead.
title: Why Is It So Bad to Pop a Pimple?

description: Ariel Henry resigned as prime minister of Haiti, leaving the way clear for a new government to be formed in the country, which has been wracked by gang violence.
title: Ariel Henry Resigns as Prime Minister of Haiti, Paving the Way for a New Government to Take Power

description: Our disastrous experience with the war on drugs invites us to recover a sense of constitutional possibility.
title: Do Americans Have a Constitutional Right to Use Drugs?

description: “This case has huge implications for the presidency, for the future of the presidency, for the future of the country,” said Justice Brett Kavanaugh.
title: From Military Coups to Selling Nuclear Secrets, Supreme Court Wrestles With Implications of Granting Trump Immunity

description: Puerto Ricans select delegates this week for the RNC and DNC. Later this year, elections here could have an even bigger impact.
title: Puerto Rico Is Voting for Its Future

description: New York’s top court on Thursday overturned Harvey Weinstein's 2020 rape conviction, the watershed case that sparked the #MeToo movement.
title: Harvey Weinstein’s 2020 Rape Conviction Overturned. Here’s What Happens Next

description: In an unprecedented year, the core of journalism remains the same
title: Why This Election Is the Media’s Opportunity to Rebuild Trust

description: BPA and phthalates are everywhere. A new test can reveal how much of both are in your body.
title: A Test Told Me I’m Basically Made of Plastic. You Probably Are Too

description: Two military horses that bolted and ran miles through London after being spooked and tossing their riders are in serious condition.
title: 2 Military Horses That Broke Free and Ran Loose Across London Are in Serious Condition

description: The sails of Paris' iconic Moulin Rouge windmill collapsed overnight. Here's what we know so far.
title: Paris’ World-Famous Cabaret Club Moulin Rouge Loses Its Windmill Sails Overnight

description: Bruce Gilley, a professor at Portland State University, drew anger across Malaysia after likening the country’s pro-Palestinian stance to advocating a “second Holocaust” during a visiting lecture.
title: An American Professor Was Hounded Out of Malaysia After Saying Its Pro-Palestinian Government Advocates a ‘Second Holocaust’

description: Kyriakos Mitsotakis lays out his vision for a different brand of conservatism—and for a more modern Greece.
title: Greece’s Prime Minister Wants His Nation to be the Comeback Story of the Decade

description: When you love your work, or if you’re very purpose-driven, your job will demand a lot of you. This causes burnout, too, writes Kandi Wiens.
title: When Meaningful Work Backfires

description: Frustrated by “hit-and-run” tourists, the Venetian government has implemented an experimental scheme to charge €5 to day trippers.
title: Venice Has Begun Charging an Access Fee to Try to Curb ‘Hit-and-Run’ Tourists

description: Shafik has navigated world conflicts at global financial institutions, but it remains to be seen if she can handle the thorny protests sweeping her campus.
title: Minouche Shafik Has Navigated Global Crises. Columbia President Could Be Her Toughest Role

description: Total births in the U.S. last year fell 2% to 3.59 million, as birth rates in countries around the world have been declining.
title: U.S. Births Last Year Fell to Lowest Since 1979

description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken has put on a friendly face during his visit to Shanghai, but the Washington-Beijing relationship remains broken.
title: In China, Blinken Tries to Fix the Unfixable

description: Actress and TIME Earth Award honoree Jane Fonda urged Americans to leverage their voting power to make politicians care about the climate crisis.
title: Jane Fonda on How People Can Make Politicians Care About Climate

description: ‘Father of Environmental Justice’ and TIME Earth Award honoree Robert Bullard discussed the importance of marrying information with action.
title: ‘Father of Environmental Justice’ Robert Bullard on the Work Behind a Movement

description: Designer and TIME Earth Award honoree Gabriela Hearst touched on clean energy and how she tries to be a “catalyst” for the next generation of leaders.
title: Gabriela Hearst on the Energy the Sustainability Movement Needs

description: Former Secretary of State and TIME Earth Award honoree discussed the importance of funding, effective communication, and collective action.
title: John Kerry on How to Break Through on the Climate Crisis

description: Former Secretary of State and TIME Earth Award honoree discussed the importance of funding, effective communication, and collective action.
title: John Kerry on How to Break Through on the Climate Crisis

description: Ecuadorian Indigenous environmental activist and TIME Earth Award honoree Nemonte Nenquimo spoke about collective responsibility toward the climate crisis.
title: Nemonte Nenquimo Says Mother Earth Is Calling and We All Need to Listen

description: The acceleration with which AI can transform society is practically unprecedented—and, business leaders argued at the TIME100 Summit, with proper regulation, that should be a good thing.
title: A Call for Embracing AI—But With a ‘Human Touch’

description: At the Time100 Summit, three healthcare officials discussed how the concept of meeting people where they are could help improve the whole industry.
title: Why It’s Important to ‘Meet People Where They Are’ When Improving U.S. Healthcare

description: Civil rights activists Amanda Nguyen and Kelley Robinson said joy is crucial in the fight for an equal future at the TIME100 Summit
title: Amanda Nguyen and Kelley Robinson Say Joy Is Crucial to Ensuring an Equal Future
